__e: Hogan, this is your fault, and you've got do something!
( clearing throat ) It is disquieting, Hogan, to have someone inside your head, yes?
You know something, Hogan? That has always been my problem. Mm-hmm.
( clearing throat ) It is disquieting, Hogan, to have someone inside your head, yes?
I've got a lot of work to do.
Hogan, you stay right here until I tell you to go.
He has obviously deserted. Hogan, you told me I would never hear from him again and you were right.
Hogan, I want you to know that I'm not through with you yet.
Please, Colonel, you push me too far. What's the matter, Schultz?
Colonel Hogan, if you had not been captured, what would you be doing right now?
Colonel Klink... Hogan, whatever it is, it will have to wait until tomorrow.
Hogan, you've had it too easy.
Colonel Hogan, I've heard so much about you, I feel I've known you for a long time.
Colonel Hogan... it is not likely that we will ever see each other again, so we can be frank, no?
Colonel Hogan, I've heard so much about you, I feel I've known you for a long time.
Hogan, I appreciate what you did, but those terrible things you said...
Trouble with you, Colonel Hogan, is you never know when someone is making a joke.
You may be right. And I think Colonel Hogan had a very good suggestion.
I'm sure Colonel Hogan has a million things to do.
Hogan slept with half the women in this building, Sinclair.
